summary: The Scotland men's football team, led by the Scottish Football Association, competes in major tournaments like the FIFA World Cup and UEFA events. They play most home games at Hampden Park. Scotland is one of the oldest national teams, first playing England in 1872. Despite qualifying for several World Cups and European Championships, they've never advanced past the initial stage. Notable wins include defeating England at Wembley and France during Euro 2008 qualifying. Fans are called the Tartan Army. Kenny Dalglish is Scotland's most-capped player with 102 appearances and 30 goals.
title: Scotland national football team
